processed.result: You are given a line with several points. Each point has a strength.  When a point is activated, it destroys all points to its left within a certain distance. You need to add a new point to the line to minimize the number of points destroyed when they are activated from right to left.

You are given $n$ beacons located at distinct positions on a number line. The $i$-th beacon has position $a_i$ and power level $b_i$. When the $i$-th beacon is activated, it destroys all beacons to its left (direction of decreasing coordinates) within distance $b_i$ inclusive. The beacon itself is not destroyed.

A new beacon needs to be added strictly to the right of all existing beacons.  Find the minimum number of beacons that will be destroyed if the new beacon is placed in a way that minimizes the number of destroyed beacons. 

**Input:**

* The first line contains an integer $n$ (1 ≤ $n$ ≤ 100,000) representing the number of beacons.
* Each of the next $n$ lines contains two integers $a_i$ and $b_i$ (0 ≤ $a_i$ ≤ 1,000,000, 1 ≤ $b_i$ ≤ 1,000,000) representing the position and power level of the $i$-th beacon.

**Output:**

* Print a single integer representing the minimum number of beacons that could be destroyed.
